example.eg: She holds her child's hand when they cross the street.
example.egtrans: 她牵着孩子的手穿过大街。

example.eg: This container holds four litres of liquid.
example.egtrans: 这个容器可盛四公升液体。

example.eg: The mother held her crying child.
example.egtrans: 这对情侣紧紧地相拥在一起。

example.eg: Can you hold for a minute while I check that information for you?
example.egtrans: 你可以等一分钟吗？我帮你查一下信息。

example.eg: Is that knot going to hold?
example.egtrans: 那个结支撑得住吗？

example.eg: He was placed on hold for five minutes when he called.
example.egtrans: 他打电话时，对方让他不要挂断等了5分钟。

example.eg: He had a tight hold on his daughter's wrist.
example.egtrans: 他紧紧握住女儿的手腕。

example.eg: The dry food was kept down in the hold.
The wrestler used a special hold to defeat his opponent.
example.egtrans: 摔跤手使出一招特殊的擒拿手法，打败了对手。

example.eg: The new president's hold on difficult policy issues was not strong.
example.egtrans: 新总统对棘手的政策问题还不太吃得透。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 把握, 控制, 左右

example.eg: Pets travel in crates in the hold.
example.egtrans: 宠物旅行时要呆在飞机货舱的宠物箱里。

example.eg: The airline carries wheelchairs free of charge in the hold.
example.egtrans: 该航空公司用行李舱免费托运轮椅。

example.eg: The dam has held through all the storms that have passed.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 继续撑住, 坚持住, 继续顶住

example.eg: The water level held at two feet above sea level.
example.egtrans: 水位保持在海平面以上两英尺的地方。

example.eg: Leah holds the keys to the car.
example.egtrans: 莉亚有这辆车的钥匙。

example.eg: His son can't hold a job; he keeps getting fired.
example.egtrans: 他的儿子无法保住工作，总是解雇。

example.eg: The professor holds that it is best to learn a foreign language at the earliest age possible.
example.egtrans: 教授认为年龄小开始学外语效果最好。

example.eg: Could you hold this box for me for a minute?
She holds the land, but it is used by the entire family.
The police held the suspect in custody.
We held some cash in Euros in case of emergency.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保持, 保留, 留存

example.eg: I don't hold discussions with silly people.
This conference room holds up to forty people.
The rebels held their position for ten hours until reinforcements arrived.
The army sought to hold the strategic mountaintop.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 占领, 占有, 攻占

example.eg: Hold your current course for the next one hundred kilometres.
He holds that those actions should be illegal.
We will hold the meeting in the conference room.
example.egtrans: 我们将在会议室开会。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 举行, 召开, 召集

example.eg: We know that not all party members hold the same position on this issue.
example.egtrans: 我们知道在这个问题上，不是所有党员都持有同样立场。

example.eg: They still hold my past mistakes against me.
The boys started fighting so teachers came to hold them back.
example.egtrans: 男孩们开始打架，所以老师过来阻止他们。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 阻止, 阻挡, 控制, 抑制

example.eg: He held back his anger until the children had gone to bed.
example.egtrans: 他忍住怒火，直到孩子们全都睡下。//她过了糟糕的一天，再也忍不住了，流下了眼泪。

example.eg: She wants to be an actress but a lack of talent is holding her back.
example.egtrans: 她想成为一名演员，但缺乏天赋阻碍了她的发展。

example.eg: She said she had told him all about her previous marriage, but he suspected she was holding something back.
example.egtrans: 她说她已将她的前一段婚姻状况都告诉他了，但他仍怀疑她有所隐瞒。

example.eg: He didn't give me all the money today, he's holding back half of it till the work is finished.
example.egtrans: 今天他没有把所有的钱全都给我，留了一半等工作完成后支付。

example.eg: She is always holding back, afraid to share her true feelings.
example.egtrans: 她总是压抑自己的感情，不敢说出真实感受。

example.eg: Hold his arms down so he'll stop hitting me!
example.egtrans: 把他手臂按住，这样他就不能继续打我了！

example.eg: I find it hard to hold down my anger when I see someone drop litter.
example.egtrans: 看到有人乱扔垃圾时，我发现很难控制住自己的怒气。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 压制, 控制, 限制

example.eg: I've been fired four times.  I just can't hold down a job!
example.egtrans: 我已经被开除过四次了，我就是保不住自己的工作！

example.eg: Though she still felt a little sick, Lisa managed to hold down her lunch.
example.egtrans: 虽然仍然觉得有点不舒服，但丽莎还是忍住未将午饭吐出。

example.eg: The rope held fast to the boat.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 牢牢系在...上, 紧紧固定在...上

dsense.name: hold fast to [sth]
dsense.guideword: (uphold: principle, idea) (宾语多为表原则、信念之词)

example.eg: He holds fast to his socialist principles.
Prince Charles could hold forth for hours on the subject of architecture.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 长篇大论, 侃侃而谈

example.eg: I can't hold in my feelings any longer!
I hope the rain holds off till we get home.
example.egtrans: 我希望雨能推迟下，直到我们到家。

dsense.name: hold off doing [sth], hold off from doing [sth], hold off on doing [sth]

example.eg: Please hold off playing the drums until after I've gone!
example.egtrans: 请克制一下，等我离开后再打鼓吧！

trans_examp.trans_cn: 拖延, 克制，节制，忍住

example.eg: The soldiers managed to hold off the attacking forces for three days.
example.egtrans: 士兵们成功抵挡了攻击部队三天之久。

example.eg: I know you are upset, but you must hold on for the sake of the children.
example.egtrans: 我知道你很难过，但为了孩子们，你必须挺住。

example.eg: Hold on till I get there!
example.egtrans: 坚持住，等我过去！

example.eg: "Can I talk to Camille?" "Hold on. I'll see if she's here."
example.egtrans: “我能和卡米尔通话吗？”“请等一下，我看下她在不在。”

trans_examp.trans_cn: 别挂电话, 不要挂断

example.eg: If you think you are going to slip, hold on to my arm.
example.egtrans: 如果你觉得自己要滑倒了，就牢牢抓住我的手臂。

example.eg: In all the years of poverty, she managed to hold onto her dignity.
example.egtrans: 在这漫长的贫穷的岁月里，她设法保住了自己的尊严。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保持，保住, 挺住，坚持住

example.eg: I don't think the cattle feed is going to hold out until Christmas, we must order more.
example.egtrans: 我不认为牛饲料能撑过圣诞节，我们必须多订购一些。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坚持住, 支撑住, 足够撑到

example.eg: Keep attacking the enemy forces; they can't hold out much longer.
example.egtrans: 继续攻击敌军，他们撑不了多久了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坚持抵抗, 顶住, 坚持不退让

example.eg: The remote mountain village held out against the foreign armies.
example.egtrans: 这偏远的山村顶住了外国军队的进攻。//我坚决不加入Facebook。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 持续抵抗, 持续抵制

example.eg: Please don't hold out on me; just tell me who did it!
example.egtrans: 请不要瞒我了，告诉我是谁干的！

example.eg: I need Jason's help but he is holding out on me.
example.egtrans: 我需要杰森的帮助但是被他拒绝了。

example.eg: James did not accept the job straight away because he was holding out for a better offer.
example.egtrans: 詹姆斯没有马上接受那份工作，因为他在等待更好的录用机会。

example.eg: He said he would come and see me and I'll hold him to that.
Mr. Jones caught hold of Mark by the collar and dragged him off to see the headmaster.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抓住, 握住, 抓牢

dsense.name: Don't hold your breath
dsense.guideword: informal ([sth] is unlikely to happen soon)

example.eg: Neil promised that he would have everything ready; don't hold your breath, though!

trans_examp.trans_cn: 别期望太高, 还得等一阵

example.eg: The army chief had a firm hold on power in the region.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧紧抓住, 牢牢控制

example.eg: Get a firm hold of the load and make sure it's not too heavy before you lift.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抓住, 把握, 掌控

example.eg: Can you tell me where I can get hold of a watch like yours? You need to get hold of a copy of his birth certificate.
example.egtrans: 你能告诉我去哪儿可以弄到你戴的这种手表吗？你需要搞到一份他的出生证明。

example.eg: I've been trying to get hold of him all week, but he's always out.
example.egtrans: 我整个星期都在试图联系他，不过他一直都外出不在。

example.eg: She got hold of his arm and pulled him towards her.
example.egtrans: 她捉住他的手臂，将他拉向自己。

example.eg: Bella jumped on the back of Jacob's motorcycle and grabbed hold of his body.  Grab hold of the rope so that I can pull you up!
Dean grabbed hold of the opportunity to visit the beach a few times.
Sally had a hold on the horse's reins.
Any check I deposit has a hold on it for 7 days.
In New Jersey, Democrats have had a hold on the Senate seats for many years.

dsense.name: have in store, hold in store

example.eg: Nobody knows what tomorrow has in store.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 未来会有, 将来会发生什么

dsense.name: have [sth] in store for [sb], hold [sth] in store for [sb]

example.eg: Let's wait and see what next year has in store for us.

trans_examp.trans_cn: …即将发生在某人头上, 有…等待着某人

example.eg: As a songwriter, George Harrison couldn't hold a candle to Paul McCartney.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 能与…相比, 可与…相提并论

example.eg: The man was too drunk to hold a conversation.
It was unfair that she was chosen instead of me, but I'm not one to hold a grudge.
Peter holds a grudge against his co-worker, who received the promotion that Peter was hoping for.
The council will hold a meeting to discuss the road repairs.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用镜子映照, 揭开...的本色

dsense.name: hold a press conference, hold a news conference

example.eg: The senator held a press conference to explain his new proposal.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 召开新闻发布会, 举行新闻发布会

example.eg: If anything goes wrong, I will hold you accountable.
I cannot hold him accountable for what happened.
Hold this dress by for me until I get paid on Saturday.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引起他人注意, 成为关注焦点

example.eg: Freedom of speech is a concept which I hold dear.
After years of unemployment, John managed to hold down a job at the post office.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 保住饭碗, 保住工作

example.eg: My sister and her boyfriend always hold hands when watching a movie.
The contract has a hold harmless clause, which means the company is not liable.
He had to hold his anger in check when his son wrecked the car.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 对…非常器重, 对…很重视

dsense.name: hold it against [sb]
dsense.guideword: informal (bear a grudge) (因过去之事而)

example.eg: She insulted him years ago, and he still holds it against her.
Hold on a minute while I go back inside to turn off the lights.
She held on tightly to the railings as she crossed the footbridge.
He held out his hand for the dog to sniff it.
example.egtrans: 他伸出手让狗闻闻。

example.eg: Police do not hold out much hope of catching the culprits.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 要求…对…负责，要求…为…负责

example.eg: Speakers need to select stimulating topics to hold the listeners' interest.
After holding steady for years, she finally gave up and sold the failing business.
This chain will hold the post steady against the wind.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…稳住, 使…保持稳定

example.eg: I won't hold it against you if you don't want to join me.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 因某事而对某人有怨气

example.eg: The political advisor holds sway over the mind of the President.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 占统治地位，占主导地位

example.eg: The movie had an entertaining beginning, but it failed to hold the attention of the audience for the entire ninety minutes.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使人集中注意力, 让人感兴趣

dsense.name: be left holding the bag, end up holding the bag (US), be left holding the baby (UK)
hold the fort, also US: hold down the fort

example.eg: I'll hold the fort while you go on your coffee break.
Please hold the line while we try to connect you.
The receptionist asked me to hold the phone while she spoke to Dr Simpson.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 控制钱包, 控制支出

example.eg: The woman held her bag tight as she hurried along the dark street.
Tim held his girlfriend tight, before saying goodbye.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧紧拥抱, 紧紧抱住

example.eg: I'll be back in one moment - hold tight.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坚持住, 再坚持一会儿

example.eg: "Hold tight," shouted the ride operator as the rollercoaster began to move.
Hold tight, the next few months could prove to be a bumpy ride!
